name: clabber
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of food made from sour milk that has become thick : Fresh clabber was eaten with cornbread, or sugar, or molasses. The jar is allowed to remain at a temperature of 15 to 20 degrees until the milk has become clabber.
More examplesFewer examplesThe clabber is produced by lactic acid fermentation under proper conditions.They make a blue cheese using the clabber method.Clabber is milk which has soured to the point where it is thick and curdy but not separated.

If sour milk clabbers, or if you clabber it, it curdles (= becomes thick) : We use raw goats milk and allow it to clabber. The lemon juice will clabber the milk slightly.
More examplesFewer examplesCottage cheese is made by allowing the milk to clabber.The raw milk was set out by the stove to clabber.
